recommendations: **Master a Modern JavaScript Framework:**  Focus deeply on either React, Vue.js, or Angular. Choose one based on your job market research and personal preferences.  Go beyond the basics – learn about state management (Redux, Vuex, NgRx), testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress), and advanced concepts like asynchronous programming and performance optimization.  Complete a substantial personal project using your chosen framework to solidify your skills and build your portfolio.

**Develop Backend Skills:**  While you're a front-end developer, understanding the backend is crucial for building full-stack applications and improving your problem-solving abilities.  Learn a popular backend language like Node.js (with Express.js), Python (with Django or Flask), or Ruby on Rails. Focus on building RESTful APIs and integrating them with your front-end projects.  A small project connecting a front-end application to a backend API you built will significantly boost your resume.

**Enhance Your DevOps Knowledge:** Gain familiarity with version control (Git and GitHub workflows are essential), continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and containerization technologies like Docker.  Even a basic understanding of these will demonstrate your ability to work in a collaborative and production-ready environment, making you a more desirable candidate.  Explore free online courses or tutorials to get started.
